tweet.bodyText: It’s funny. I asked for advice on how to cover up infected insect bites for my wedding Yet so many want to give advice on how to treat them. As if I’ve left them festering without treating them before worrying about how to cover them. They are being treated!
@AngelaBarnes If you're having your make up done, maybe she can offer advice, they are skilled at covering up, I bet she'll have a trick up her sleeve. Have a wonderful wedding x
@AngelaBarnes …hope that’s useful. Have a wonderful day! That is, your wedding day, not just today. Though I hope today is good too 😆

@AngelaBarnes Hi Angela. I wonder if any Acne sufferers out there have any recommendations? That’s often raised/red isn’t it. I did a quick Google, there seem to be gel based barriers available for open sores (don’t know if yours are), you can then use concealer over …
@NackiNoo77 @AngelaBarnes https://t.co/sT5cQXEGVd

@AngelaBarnes Wishing you both a fab-u-lous wedding day! I suffer when bitten too, ended up having antihistamine injections in my butt on holiday once due to them so I really feel your pain. There are some great make-up's out there designed for tattoo cover up, could help🤷🏻‍♀️
@AngelaBarnes If you are still looking for a solution there are some fantastic foundations designed to cover up scars.
@AngelaBarnes I’m afraid I can’t offer any advice, but I’d like to wish you a happy day. Good luck!
@sjzara Thank you!
@AngelaBarnes You are getting married? So pleased for you! #Congratulations

@AngelaBarnes You know Twitter, never short of an opinion even when not asked for! 
Hope the wedding goes splendidly, even if you are sporting surgical or lisle stockings x
@nosila_63 Thank you! x
@AngelaBarnes Flux Capacitor. Always my first port of call. (happy weddings)
@AngelaBarnes Angela, my friend has a ‘port wine’ birthmark and uses ‘Ripar’ makeup to cover it. It is obvs very good because I didn’t know they had one. Have a brilliant day the pair of you..👍

@AngelaBarnes I really sympathise. I’ve had the same problem with allergies infected bites and my skin is a similar paleness to yours so everything shows up. I’ve tried a lot of things but once my skin is in a state like that it tends to overreact to anything I put on it for a few days.

@bossproofreader @AngelaBarnes I mainline antihistamines. There are two types of histamine receptor in the body. Over the counter ones usually work on one. If you can get a prescription that works on the other it can sometimes help. The kids and I take fexofenadine now and life is so much more comfortable.
@ClareCoyne8 @AngelaBarnes Just picked up these from the pharmacy, Clare. Annoyed with the cap f in film. https://t.co/h9yqHFA30E

@bossproofreader @ClareCoyne8 I'm sure you've been told and read the leaflet, and for someone who had moan about getting unsolicited advice, I'm about to give some, but I used to take these, and you  can't consume grapefruit or grapefruit juice while on them. PSA done - have a good day! xxx

@AngelaBarnes @ClareCoyne8 That's really useful advice, Angela.
But when are your nuptials and will you post pics? 💫
@bossproofreader @ClareCoyne8 4th Sept and yes I certainly shall! xx
@ClareCoyne8 @AngelaBarnes Ah, that's interesting. I'll be collecting some prescriptions later. Wonder which type I'll get (antihistamines don't work on me either). x

@bossproofreader @AngelaBarnes Hope it works out for you. Have a look at co-factor allergies - it can mean you’re o my allergic to something under certain circumstances. With us it’s pollen. Don’t react to, eg, tomato in the winter but very nasty exploding allergies in the summer. Took us years to work out.
@ClareCoyne8 @AngelaBarnes Oh my god, that sounds terrible!
@bossproofreader @AngelaBarnes Still don’t sleep at night tbh

@AngelaBarnes I avoided hospital at least once by using lots of ice, which reduced the redness and purpleness greatly. I’d be worried about makeup on your lovely dress. Try it out with some others first (I’m sure you will). If it works please post details because I’d love to know.
@AngelaBarnes I hope you have a wonderful day and a very happy life together.
@AngelaBarnes Ah, you see the problem is getting married in the first place….
@AngelaBarnes No advice but best wishes for the wedding
@AngelaBarnes Have you considered tattoo sleeves?! 😁
@AngelaBarnes I am not medically qualified nor a beautician but I reckon a coat of creosote will do the trick
@AngelaBarnes People are weird. You need dermablend concealer, btw, it’s good stuff and won’t transfer. When’s the wedding? Hope you’re well x

@AngelaBarnes Apologies for me saying to take antihistamines as well as the cover up make up suggestion. As someone who reacts to bites they are my 1st port of call on top of anything else. I only have hang out the washing and I get bitten. I hope you have a lovely wedding day.
@paulada44880195 No worries at all! I didn’t mean to be mean, I’m just found it interesting. I’m the same, and I’m allergic to everything, so I take antihistamines every day xx
@AngelaBarnes Phew. At least they are in your system
@AngelaBarnes Don’t know about bites but the lady who said use green makes a lot of sense. Hope you have a wonderful day. Looking forward to seeing the video where you rollerskate down the aisle.
@alileeming @AngelaBarnes Strange that you should mention rollerskating. My (tongue in cheek) suggestion was going to be rainbow leg warmers.

@alileeming @AngelaBarnes Sorry for suggesting a treatment only mentioned it as I get eaten alive every year while foraging , tried must over counter stuff to reduce inflammation never really worked , only plantain cream helped, as for cover up ain't it green base to take red down then normal color match
@skedone @alileeming No worries at all! It was just interesting, thanks for the advice, especially as plantain was something I actually HADN’T tried!
@AngelaBarnes @alileeming Yeah it's odd that it works , I'm in no way a herbalist or anything , I know through research that alot of it is crap , but that happens to be one that works lol
@alileeming Haha the last thing these legs need us a load of bruises if I stack it!
@AngelaBarnes No advice from me Angela, but hope you get it sorted and have a wonderful day.
@Welroma Thank you!

One ”splainer” (I believe it’s largely gender neutral, not always a “mansplainer”) even told me they almost certainly weren’t infected. I mean, i didn’t post a pic. And the doctor that has actually seen them and prescribed the antibiotics begs to differ!

@AngelaBarnes I saw that this morning and burst out laughing! It was brilliant! “They’re not infected“
Fuck. Right. Off.

@AngelaBarnes I once went on a group called Acts of Kindness asking for a lamp because my switch for the ceiling light was broken. I needed a light before it could be fixed. Someone replied "Lightbulb....." If that was all I needed, I would have asked for it.
@AngelaBarnes I know you said it’s gender neutral but I believe we don’t say “mansplaining” anymore - I’m told the new phrase is “Correctile Dysfunction”.

This is a funny old place, you ask one question and get a load of advice on something you didn’t ask for and don’t need. I know it’s mostly people trying to help (and a few smartarses thrown in), but I find it an interesting phenomenon

@AngelaBarnes You asked Twitter! It was bound to be interesting, but how lovely people care enough about you and your special day to give lots of helpful and nutty advice. Have a brilliant day, once you clock your lovely chap you won’t care about insect nibbles anyway. 😁

@AngelaBarnes Drives me crazy. I am in a Facebook group called Acts of Kindness. We can use it to fill in the gaps left by food banks. Some people assume those asking for food are ignorant rather than the food bank isn't enough or they can't get to it for a valid reason.
@AngelaBarnes If you spill red wine on a white carpet, just dye it pink

@AngelaBarnes I use something called Rosalique on my face (because I have quite severe acne rosacia) it is very bright green but covers all redness and any other colour on skin. If it doesn't give quite the right shade, you can add powder or foundation. Works for me, hope that helps.
@hoops504 Thank you!

@AngelaBarnes It's not unique to Twitter... I posted a jokey status on FB once, about my general dislike of the texture of porridge, and got loads of recipes! I sympathise. I had infected insect bites once and had to get antibiotics. I felt really ill.
@AngelaBarnes As I always say if people answered the question they are actually being asked instead the one they think they are being asked it’d save a lot of hassle!!

@AngelaBarnes Have you tried going back in time & avoiding being bitten?
After reading some replies this sounds a lot easier, & surely @daraobriain can hook you up with a time-pod. I've seen him on BBC2 looking old, then moments later on @davechannel looking 10 years younger, coincidence???
@AngelaBarnes To be honest whenever you post anything, no matter what it's about, my first reaction is to ask if you're going to post anymore roller skating videos.
@AngelaBarnes "I don't know the answer but my daughter once got stung by a horse-fly"

@craiguito @AngelaBarnes If you drink enough tonic water it will prevent further insect bites.
You’re welcome.
@AngelaBarnes The internet, since the days of message boards, and before has always been so. A whole thread of people answering a question that wasn’t asked, in slightly different ways.
@AngelaBarnes Isn't that related to some kind of internet rule? That the easiest way to get the correct answer to a question in to state that the wrong answer is correct?
@AngelaBarnes Dulux undercoat?

@AngelaBarnes There are some people who listen to you when you talk and there's other people who just wait for their turn.

There are some who read your post and some who just respond without any comprehension?
@AngelaBarnes All part of the “I’m right and you’re wrong” generation. Much rather be proven right than to actually help you
@russburt @AngelaBarnes It's not a generational thing.
@AngelaBarnes I think it's worst for comedians.  You could tweet that you've had a heart attack or a horrible accident and the last thing you'd see would be replies from people trying to be funny.
@drtoriaredfern Oh yeah, haven’t even mentioned the trying to be funny ones! They are always there!
@AngelaBarnes @drtoriaredfern Sorry 🙂
@AngelaBarnes It’s so annoying. Especially when the advice has nothing to do with the subject! Anyway, here’s my advice on getting a red wine stain out of a white rug……
@yokelbear Where would I be without you? Xx

@AngelaBarnes Did anyone suggest a colour corrector under a concealer? Green ones help to neutralise red tones. I would also use a primer for staying power (and if you have a photographer, ask them to touch up pics too)
@QueenoftheBerri Ooh lovely, thanks!
@AngelaBarnes Try putting kitchen paper over the hardened wax in your carpet, then iron over it. Hey presto, wax melts into the paper, problem solved.
@mrjohnofarrell @AngelaBarnes Don't you then put it in an old takeaway container full of rice?
@RufusHound @mrjohnofarrell @AngelaBarnes Exactly. And then pour *white* wine on it.
@ELTAuthor @mrjohnofarrell @AngelaBarnes Only if you've used red rice.
@mrjohnofarrell THANK GOD YOU ARE HERE
@AngelaBarnes Isn't being a smartarse the basis of a lot of comedy?
@AngelaBarnes It's like trip advisor reviews.... Some good some bad but there may be some useful ones..
@dogdirtbiker13 Oh there have been a lot of useful ones, I just find it interesting
@AngelaBarnes Hope your wedding is fantastic 😁
@dogdirtbiker13 Thanks!
@AngelaBarnes https://t.co/T2JDd1WUse
@HesamSaid 😂😂😂
@AngelaBarnes I hope your legs feel better and you have a wonderful wedding day xx
